column1: Hsin-chu is the Wade-Giles romanization of the Mandarin pronunciation of the Chinese name 新竹市(Sin-tik-chhī). The same name is rendered Xīnzhú in Hanyu Pinyin and Sinjhú in Tongyong Pinyin.

column1: Hsinchu's climate is humid subtropical (Koppen: Cfa). The city is located in a part of the island that has a rainy season that lasts from February to September
column2: with the heaviest time coming late April through August during the southwest monsoon
column3: and also experiences meiyu in May and early June. The city succumbs to hot humid weather from June until September
column4: while October to December are arguably the most pleasant times of year. Hsinchu is affected by easterly winds off of the East China Sea. Natural hazards such as typhoons and earthquakes are common in the region.
